content: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

content: God is dead! He remains dead! And we have killed him.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
author: Aristotle

content: Man is born free, and everywhere he is in chains.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

content: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

content: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

content: Liberty consists in doing what one desires.
author: John Stuart Mill

content: Even while they teach, men learn.
author: Seneca
